byline.contributor: Andy Newman and Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Italy's Supreme Court of Cassation overturns murder convictions of former American exchange student Amanda Knox and Italian man Raffaele Sollecito; defendants are granted full acquittal in 2007 stabbing death of British student Meredith Kercher; full exoneration in such a complicated case is uncommon in the Italian justice system, and many react with initial disbelief.
lead_paragraph: The acquittal of Ms. Knox and her former boyfriend, Raffaele Sollecito, ended a long-running legal drama over the killing of a British student.

headline.main: Amanda Knox Acquitted of 2007 Murder by Italy’s Highest Court
headline.print_headline: Court Clears Amanda Knox of All Charges in 2007 Killing

snippet: The acquittal of Ms. Knox and her former boyfriend, Raffaele Sollecito, ended a long-running legal drama over the killing of a British student.
